main event: On December 11, 1955, at Camp Pomponio, California, a civilian observed a shining object with flashing green, yellow, and white lights, which remained stationary for 10-15 minutes before slowly vanishing to the east. The observation lasted over 1 hour and the object was described as a shining object with flashing lights.
interesting points: The object was observed for over 1 hour, providing ample time for detailed study.
The object had flashing green, yellow, and white lights, which is unusual for conventional aircraft or astronomical phenomena.
The source, a civilian camp ranger, was a former US Navy personnel with experience as a gun-pointer on a 20mm gun, lending credibility to the witness.
The report included supplementary investigative efforts, including checks with the Hamilton Flight Service Center and the Lick Observatory, but yielded negative results for conventional explanations.

The preparing officer suggested that the sighting was probably caused by an unknown planet shining through a thin layer of clouds, but the approving officer believed it was probably caused by the star Betelgeuse, rather than an unknown planet.
witnesses: Civilian camp ranger with previous military experience
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
